alert.note: Alert for Lamoille (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 8:27PM EDT until July 12 at 12:35PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Lamoille River At Jeffersonville affecting Lamoille County. For the Lamoille River...including East Georgia, Johnson, Jeffersonville...Major flooding is forecast to continue. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Lamoille River at Jeffersonville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Impacts until the river falls below 453.5 feet... flooding will continue in Jeffersonville along Main Street, Depot Street, and Maple Street. Route 15 between Johnson and Fairfax will be inundated and impassable in some areas. Widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax will continue. Impacts until the river falls below 450.0 feet...Road flooding will continue in and around Cambridge Village. Widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville through Fairfax will continue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 455.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 447.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EDT Tuesday was 456.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 446.8 feet later tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 450.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 454.5 feet on 11/01/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 830 AM EDT.
